summary: This is an internal email forwarding a CNBC news article reporting that Ghislaine Maxwell, a friend of Jeffrey Epstein, is under FBI investigation. It was sent from Nicholas Blase to several recipients including Geoffrey Berman.

persons.name: Nicholas Blase
persons.context: Sent an email from his iPhone forwarding a CNBC news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's FBI investigation to colleagues including Geoffrey Berman.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of FBI investigation, friend of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in a forwarded CNBC article as being under FBI investigation and described as a friend of the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier, associate of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the late financier whose friend, Ghislaine Maxwell, is under FBI investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: Recipient of internal email (US Attorney for the Southern District of New York)
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of an internal email forwarding a news article about the FBI investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Described in the forwarded news article as friends.
Blase sent an email to Berman, indicating a professional correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: CNBC reports Ghislaine Maxwell under FBI investigation
events.description: CNBC publishes an article reporting that Ghislaine Maxwell, a friend of Jeffrey Epstein, is under investigation by the FBI.

keyFacts: As of December 27, 2019, Ghislaine Maxwell was publicly reported to be under investigation by the FBI.
The information was disseminated internally within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York via email.
The email was sent from Nicholas Blase's iPhone, forwarding a CNBC news article.
The document is a record of internal communication about a developing public investigation.
